skill.name: skill-installer
skill.description: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos).
skill.summary: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a u...
skill.author: openai

security_audit.summary: This skill installs Codex skills from GitHub repositories. The code includes path traversal protection, safe zip extraction, and requires user escalation for network operations. No malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Finding and installing new skills for Codex requires navigating GitHub manually. This skill automates installation from curated lists or any GitHub repository, supporting both public and private repos with proper authentication.
actual_capabilities: List available curated skills from the OpenAI skills repository
Install skills from curated list by name
Install skills from any GitHub repository by owner/repo/path
Support private repositories using GitHub token authentication
Fallback to git sparse checkout when direct download fails
Validate skill structure and prevent overwriting existing installations
limitations: Only supports GitHub as the skill source repository
Cannot install skills from local files or other version control systems
System skills are preinstalled and cannot be re-installed
GitHub API rate limits may affect listing performance

use_cases.title: Explore available skills
use_cases.description: Browse the curated skill library to discover new capabilities for your Codex installation.

use_cases.title: Install team skills
use_cases.description: Deploy custom skills from private team repositories across your organization.

use_cases.title: Add custom skills
use_cases.description: Install specialized skills from any public GitHub repository to extend Codex functionality.

prompt_templates.title: List available skills
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to see what skills are available
prompt_templates.prompt: What curated skills are available to install?

prompt_templates.title: Install by name
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to install a specific skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the skill-1 skill from the curated list.

prompt_templates.title: Install from GitHub
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to install from a specific repo
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the python-helper skill from the github.com/myorg/skills repository.

prompt_templates.title: Private repo install
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to install from a private repo
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the enterprise-skill from github.com/company/private-skills using my GITHUB_TOKEN.

output_examples.input: What curated skills are available to install?
output: Which ones would you like installed?

best_practices: Restart Codex after installing new skills to ensure they are loaded properly
Use GITHUB_TOKEN or GH_TOKEN environment variables for private repository access
Install multiple skills at once by specifying multiple --path arguments
anti_patterns: Do not attempt to overwrite system skills as they are preinstalled
Do not skip the restart step after installation completes
Do not use absolute paths or path traversal sequences in skill names

faq.question: Does this skill work with private GitHub repositories?
faq.answer: Yes. Set the GITHUB_TOKEN or GH_TOKEN environment variable to authenticate with private repos.

faq.question: Where are skills installed on my system?
faq.answer: Skills are installed to $CODEX_HOME/skills, which defaults to ~/.codex/skills.

faq.question: Can I integrate this skill with other automation tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the --format json flag for machine-readable output suitable for scripts and pipelines.

faq.question: Is my code safe when installing skills from GitHub?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill validates paths and extracts archives safely to prevent directory traversal attacks.

faq.question: What should I do if installation fails?
faq.answer: Check that the repository exists, the path is correct, and you have proper authentication for private repos. Try the --method git fallback option.

faq.question: How is this different from manual skill installation?
faq.answer: This skill automates the entire process including authentication handling, git sparse checkout fallback, and installation validation.
